result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Jo Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amy Jo Schultz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amy Jo Schultz was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs of $268.00 - work out payment with agent.  Submit DNA sample and pay $250.00 surcharge.

Not allowed to possess firearms.  Not allowed to vote or sit on a jury until civil rights are restored.   Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  All prescriptions to be approved by agent.    May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.

Any assessments and counselling as directed by the agent.  AODA and follow thru.  Laminate the letter she read in court today and reread it to herself every week.  Do random drug testing and cooperate with the agent.  Court has no objection to Probation being transferred to Minnesota.    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Credit for 140 days and work release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
